definition: heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(negative prefix)/not/no
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: But sometimes, us gentlemen say things that we really do not mean.
sentences.chinese: 可是有时候我们男人也会心口不一。
心口不一啊，汝的名字是哈珀。

definition: duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
false/hypocritical/artificial/sham
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
see 刀子嘴，豆腐心[dao1 zi5 zui3 , dou4 fu5 xin1]
false friendship/hypocritical show of affection
glib/oily-mouthed and smooth talking
to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)

definition: to be all talk and no action
small-minded/petty/narrow-minded
to speak harshly but without any bad intent (idiom)
